poem:
Title: In Half-Lit Spaces of Sound 

Veined hands strum 
the guitar's old map,
under dusky shadow poles.
A fusion drawn from boredom's lap,
chemistry, and muses trapped 
in men. Pinned as beetles 
on telephone's silent call,
their melody - a language deep, 
tuned to eleven, beyond all.
Satire dressed as deliberate sleep,
echoes in the cinema's weep.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "This Is Spinal Tap at 40: the note-perfect rock satire still goes up to 11 The bands that come together organically, without the aid of want ads or tear-off flyers stapled to telephone poles, are generally catalyzed by a mixture of chemistry, inspiration and boredom. Related: This Is Spinal Tap at 35: the faux-rockers reunite at Tribeca film festival A few guys – more often than not, it’s still guys – hang out, realize they". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
